main_definition: To create or shape something with effort, typically in a creative or skillful manner.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Make an imitation of (a document) by altering its appearance to give the impression that it is genuine.
meanings_and_examples.example: The counterfeiter forged his own passport, complete with a fake photograph.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Work hard at (something), especially as part of training or preparation.
meanings_and_examples.example: She devoted herself to forging her skills in the art of pottery through years of practice and study.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Deceive by falsifying a document, signature, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The suspect attempted to forge his father's signature on an important legal document.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Make or shape (metal) in a furnace by heating and hammering; also, make or form (clay) into items of pottery.
meanings_and_examples.example: The blacksmith was skilled at forging iron tools with precision and care.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Develop fully or intensively in a particular area by effort or training.
meanings_and_examples.example: His dedication to the sport allowed him to forge himself into one of the top athletes in his league.
